qas.question: In what year was Studio Misr founded?
In more that 100 years how many films have been produced in Egypt?
What share of Arab productions have come from Egypt?

context: Egyptian cinema became a regional force with the coming of sound. In <a0_0>1936<a0_0/>, Studio Misr, financed by industrialist <a1_0>Talaat Harb<a1_0/>, emerged as the leading Egyptian studio, a role the company retained for three decades. For over 100 years, more than <a2_0>4000 films<a2_0/> have been produced in Egypt, <a3_0>three quarters<a3_0/> of the total Arab production.[citation needed] Egypt is considered the leading country in the field of cinema in the Middle East. Actors from all over the Arab World seek to appear in the Egyptian cinema for the sake of fame. The Cairo International Film Festival has been rated as one of 11 festivals with a top class rating worldwide by the International Federation of Film Producers' Associations.
